intro: Psychotria oaxacensis, commonly known as the Oaxacan psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered white flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant contains psychoactive alkaloids, making it of interest in both botanical and ethnopharmacological studies.
